newsitem.title: USA: EP Medsystems says sees record Q1 sales.
newsitem.headline: EP Medsystems says sees record Q1 sales.

text.p: EP MedSystems said Tuesday it expects to report record sales in the first quarter of 1997 because of a change in its sales force.

"While we were somewhat disappointed with the sales revenues for the fourth quarter, we are confident that our switch to a direct sales force will be beneficial in the long term. In fact, it appears that our first quarter of 1997 will show our highest sales in comparison to any previous quarterly results," said David A. Jenkins, president and chief executive officer.

For the fourth quarter of 1996, revenues were $307,803, as compared with revenues of $477,135 for the year-ago period. Net loss for the period was $975,536 or $0.13 per share, as compared to a net loss of $932,221, or $0.16 per share.

"1996 was a monumental year for EP MedSystems," stated Jenkins. "We achieved a number of milestones, including completion of our initial public offering, initial acceptance of the EP WorkMate computerized electrophysiology workstation, hiring of a direct sales and marketing team, improving our international distribution network and obtaining ISO 9001 approval of our catheter manufacturing facility," he said.
